item.title: 日经新闻》报道：Couche-Tard 董事长称不会恶意收购 Seven & i 公司
item.description: 日经商业日报》（Nikkei business daily）援引加拿大收购方董事长兼联合创始人阿兰-布沙尔（Alain Bouchard）的话说，Alimentation Couche-Tard 没有考虑对日本 Seven & i 进行恶意收购。【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard is not considering a hostile takeover bid for Japan's Seven & i , the Nikkei business daily quoted the Canadian suitor's chairman and co-founder, Alain Bouchard, as saying.】

item.title: 鸟击事件发生后，FAA 将召集委员会审查 737 MAX 发动机问题
item.description: 2023 年，美国西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）的飞机发生了两起鸟击事件，联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）计划在未来几周内召开纠正措施审查委员会会议，审议波音 737 MAX 飞机发动机的安全问题。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration plans to convene a corrective action review board in the coming weeks to consider safety concerns about engines on Boeing 737 MAX airplanes after two bird strike incidents on Southwest Airlines planes in 2023.】

item.title: 波音公司获得价值 23.8 亿美元的合同，为美国空军增购 15 架 KC-46A 加油机
item.description: 波音公司周四表示，它已从美国空军获得一份价值23.8亿美元的合同，将根据第11批采购计划再建造15架KC-46A "飞马 "空中加油机。【原文：Boeing said on Thursday it has secured a $2.38 billion contract from the U.S. Air Force to build 15 additional KC-46A Pegasus aerial refueling tankers under the Lot 11 procurement.】

item.title: 日本 10 月核心通胀放缓，但仍高于日本央行目标
item.description: 日本 10 月份核心消费者价格同比上涨 2.3%，涨幅较 9 月份有所放缓，但继续超过央行设定的 2% 的目标，这表明进一步加息的条件正在逐步具备。【原文：Japan's core consumer prices in October rose 2.3% from a year earlier, slowing from September's pace but continuing to exceed the central bank's 2% target in a sign conditions for further interest rate hikes were falling in place.】

item.title: 巴西抨击家乐福誓言不让南方共同市场肉类上架
item.description: 在法国零售商家乐福的首席执行官誓言将南美肉类从法国的货架上撤下以声援农民之后，巴西政府对家乐福进行了抨击，称其言论是破坏即将达成的贸易协议的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：Brazil's government has blasted French retailer Carrefour after its CEO vowed to keep South American meat off its shelves in France in solidarity with farmers, calling the comments part of a wider push to undermine a pending trade deal.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势加剧，中国企业寻求美元支持
item.description: 由于贸易紧张局势有可能动摇外汇汇率，中国企业正在囤积更多美元，用人民币为合同定价，并开通进口航线，以降低货币风险。【原文：Chinese firms are squirreling away even more dollars, pricing contracts in yuan and opening import lines to mitigate currency risks as trade tensions threaten to roil foreign exchange rates.】

item.title: 罗斯百货因成本下降上调年度利润预期，股价上涨
item.description: 非价格零售商罗斯百货公司（Ross Stores）周四上调了年度利润预期，原因是运费和供应链成本的降低有助于缓解其门店销售放缓的影响，这使得其股价在收盘后上涨了 7%。【原文：Off-price retailer Ross Stores raised its annual profit forecast on Thursday, as lower freight and supply-chain costs helped soften the impact of slowing sales at its stores, sending its shares up 7% after the bell.】

item.title: 亚洲以恢复力为王，关注日本 CPI
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 比特币迈向 10 万美元的狂野之旅
item.description: 共和党人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）当选总统后，人们更加期待他的政府将为加密货币创造一个友好的监管环境。【原文：Bitcoin neared $100,000 for the first time on Thursday as the election of Republican Donald Trump as president fuelled expectations that his administration will create a friendly regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，麦肯锡接近就美国阿片类药物调查达成延期起诉协议
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，麦肯锡公司正处于就一项暂缓起诉协议进行谈判的最后阶段，以解决美国对该咨询公司帮助阿片类药物制造商提高销售额的刑事调查，据称该调查助长了致命的成瘾流行病。【原文：McKinsey & Co is in the final stages of negotiating a deferred prosecution agreement to resolve a U.S. criminal investigation into the consulting firm's work helping opioid manufacturers boost sales that allegedly contributed to a deadly addiction epidemic, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 据《信息报》报道，OpenAI 考虑用浏览器对抗谷歌
item.description: 据 The Information 周四报道，ChatGPT 的所有者 OpenAI 最近考虑开发一款能与其聊天机器人结合的网络浏览器，并分别讨论或达成了各种交易，以支持搜索功能。【原文：ChatGPT-owner OpenAI has recently considered developing a web browser that would combine with its chatbot, and has separately discussed or struck various deals to power search features, the Information reported on Thursday.】

item.title: Gap 提高年度销售目标，押注稳定的假日需求
item.description: Gap 公司周四上调了年度销售预期，表明随着假日季节的临近，Old Navy 母公司的休闲服装需求稳定。【原文：Gap Inc raised its annual sales forecast on Thursday, signaling steady demand for the Old Navy parent's casual wear apparel, as the holiday season approaches.】

item.title: 特朗普的华尔街猎头行动让阿波罗成为焦点
item.description: 就在阿波罗联合创始人之间就接班人问题展开激烈争夺的几年后，如果其董事长和首席执行官双双离职，为美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普工作，这家另类资产管理巨头可能会面临新的动荡。【原文：Just a few years after a bruising battle among Apollo's co-founders over succession, the alternative asset manager giant could face new upheaval if its chairman and chief executive both leave to work for U.S. President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 圭亚那政府称埃克森美孚退出与圭亚那的浅水石油区块谈判
item.description: 南美圭亚那副总统周四表示，美国石油巨头埃克森美孚公司已退出与圭亚那政府就勘探和开发浅水区块条款的谈判。【原文：U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil has pulled out of negotiations with Guyana's government on terms for exploring and developing a shallow-water block, the South American country's vice president said on Thursday.】

item.title: 在受到美国贿赂和欺诈指控后，高塔姆-阿达尼的下一步打算是什么？
item.description: 印度企业集团阿达尼集团（Adani Group）董事长、亿万富翁、世界上最富有的人之一高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌参与一项数十亿美元的欺诈和贿赂计划而受到刑事指控，他可能面临在美国接受审判的漫长道路。【原文：Gautam Adani, the billionaire chair of Indian conglomerate Adani Group and one of the world's richest people, could face a long road to trial in the U.S. on criminal charges over his alleged role in a multi-billion-dollar fraud and bribery scheme.】

item.title: 美国强制出售谷歌 Chrome 浏览器为何面临法律障碍
item.description: 美国反垄断监管机构试图通过强制出售谷歌 Chrome 浏览器和其他限制其搜索主导地位的建议来瓦解 Alphabet，但这些努力很可能会遭遇法律挑战，理由是这些补救措施过于极端。【原文：Efforts by U.S. antitrust regulators to break up Alphabet by forcing a sale of its Google Chrome browser and other proposals to limit its search dominance are likely to run into legal challenges on grounds the remedies are extreme.】

item.title: Snap 寻求驳回新墨西哥州有关儿童安全的诉讼
item.description: Snap 周四提出动议，要求驳回新墨西哥州的一项诉讼，该诉讼指控这家科技公司在其消息应用 Snapchat 上允许对儿童进行性剥削，并认为该州的调查存在不准确之处。【原文：Snap on Thursday filed a motion to dismiss a New Mexico lawsuit that alleged the tech company enabled child sexual exploitation on its messaging app Snapchat, arguing there were inaccuracies to the state's investigation.】

item.title: 汽车制造商敦促特朗普保留电动汽车税收减免政策，促进自动驾驶汽车发展
item.description: 代表通用汽车、丰田汽车公司和大众汽车等主要汽车制造商的一个团体敦促当选总统唐纳德-特朗普保留对购买电动汽车的关键税收减免，并采取措施加快自动驾驶汽车的部署。【原文：A group representing major automakers including General Motors , Toyota Motor Corp , and Volkswagen urged President-elect Donald Trump to retain key tax credits for electric vehicle purchases and take steps to speed deployment of self-driving cars.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，美国银行驻印度的三名银行家因涉嫌向客户通风报信而离职
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周四援引三位熟悉内情的人士的话报道称，美国银行印度投资银行业务联席主管和另外两位银行家已经离职，原因是该公司正在对有关不当行为的指控进行调查。【原文：Bank of America's co-head of investment banking in India and two other bankers have left the company amid an investigation into wrongdoing allegations, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 斯堪尼亚称将根据美国破产保护协议向 Northvolt 提供 1 亿美元贷款
item.description: 瑞典卡车制造商斯堪尼亚（Scania）周四表示，作为陷入困境的瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt 美国破产保护协议的一部分，斯堪尼亚将向 Northvolt 贷款 1 亿美元。【原文：Swedish truckmaker Scania said on Thursday it will lend Northvolt $100 million as part of the struggling Swedish battery maker's U.S. Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection deal.】

item.title: 加密货币行业争夺特朗普承诺的理事会席位
item.description: 据几位数字资产行业高管透露，包括瑞波（Ripple）、Kraken 和 Circle 在内的许多加密货币公司都在争夺当选总统唐纳德-特朗普许诺的加密货币顾问委员会的席位，希望在他计划的美国政策改革中获得发言权。【原文：A slew of crypto companies including Ripple, Kraken and Circle are jostling for a seat on President-elect Donald Trump's promised crypto advisory council, seeking a say in his planned overhaul of U.S. policy, according to several digital asset industry executives.】

item.title: Citadel 的格里芬表示愿意出售旗下对冲基金的少数股权
item.description: Citadel 创始人肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）周四表示，他愿意在未来某个时候出售其对冲基金的少量股份。【原文：Citadel's founder Ken Griffin said on Thursday that he would be open to selling a small stake in his hedge fund at some point in the future.】

item.title: 瑞典 Northvolt 公司申请破产，欧洲电动汽车雄心受挫
item.description: 瑞典电动汽车电池制造商 Northvolt 周四表示，该公司已在美国申请破产保护，这对欧洲希望其最发达的电池生产商能减少西方汽车制造商对中国竞争对手依赖的希望造成了打击。【原文：Northvolt, the Swedish maker of battery cells for electric vehicles, said on Thursday it has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the U.S., dealing a blow to Europe's hopes that its most developed battery player would reduce Western car makers' reliance on Chinese rivals.】

item.title: 即将上任的 FCC 主席称委员会不可能恢复星链补贴
item.description: 即将上任的联邦通信委员会主席表示，该委员会 "不太可能 "重新考虑其 2022 年拒绝向埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 卫星互联网公司 Starlink 提供 8.855 亿美元农村宽带补贴的决定。【原文：The incoming chair of the Federal Communications Commission said it is "very unlikely" the commission could reconsider its 2022 decision to deny Elon Musk's SpaceX satellite internet unit Starlink $885.5 million in rural broadband subsidies.】

item.title: 福克斯与 Hulu 宣布建立多年内容流媒体合作伙伴关系
item.description: 福克斯娱乐公司和 Hulu 周四宣布达成一项多年内容协议，迪士尼控制的流媒体平台将保留福克斯大量节目的流媒体播放权。【原文：Fox Entertainment and Hulu announced on Thursday a multi-year content deal whereby the Walt Disney-controlled streaming platform will retain the streaming rights for Fox's extensive programming slate.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比称降息步伐可能需要放缓
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周四重申，他支持进一步降息，并对以更缓慢的速度降息持开放态度。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee on Thursday reiterated his support for further interest rate cuts and his openness to doing them more slowly, remarks that underscore the U.S. central bank's debate that it's not about whether, but over how fast and how far, borrowing costs should be lowered.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期固定利率抵押贷款接近 7
item.description: 本周，美国抵押贷款利率升至四个月来的新高，再加上房价上涨，可能会在短期内将潜在购房者拒之于住房市场之外。【原文：U.S. mortgage rates increased to a four-month high this week, which together with higher home prices could sideline potential buyers from the housing market in the near term.】

item.title: 美国法院撤销美国证券交易委员会关于国债市场的 "交易商规则
item.description: 据法庭记录显示，德克萨斯州一名联邦法官周四否决了美国证券交易委员会今年早些时候通过的影响深远的国债市场法规，认为该机构在发布这些法规时超越了其法律权限。【原文：A federal judge in Texas on Thursday struck down far-reaching regulations on the Treasury markets adopted earlier this year by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, finding that the agency had overstepped its legal authority in issuing the regulations, according to court records.】

item.title: 纽约联储称截至 11 月中旬银行储备充足
item.description: 纽约联储的最新数据显示，美国央行在继续推进缩减资产负债表规模的努力方面没有遇到任何障碍。【原文：New data from the New York Federal Reserve suggests the U.S. central bank isn't facing any roadblocks to continuing forward with its ongoing effort to shrink the size of its balance sheet.】

item.title: 安全问题引发关注，FCC 建议对中国视频门铃制造商处以罚款
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会（Federal Communications Commission）周四建议对中国视频门铃制造商易建公司罚款近73.5万美元，原因是该公司提供虚假信息并引发了安全问题。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission on Thursday proposed to fine Chinese-based video doorbell manufacturer Eken nearly $735,000 for providing false information and after security concerns were raised.】
